intro: Hordeum vulgare var. brachyura, commonly known as barley dwarf, is a variety of barley characterized by its shorter stature compared to standard barley. It is a grass species belonging to the Poaceae family and is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, blade-like leaves and compact spikelets. It produces small, three-branched flowers that develop into hard, amber-colored grains. This variety is often cultivated for its high yield and adaptability to various soil conditions.
